properties.description: This initiative includes policies that address the Dutch Baseline Informatiebeveiliging (BIO) controls specifically for the 'thema-uitwerking Clouddiensten' and include policies covered under the SOC2 and ISO 27001:2013 controls.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01 - Laws and Regulations
policyDefinitionGroups.description: All relevant legal, statutory, regulatory, contractual requirements and the CSP's approach to meeting these requirements

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01.1 - Legal, statutory, regulatory requirements
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP informs the CSC which laws and regulations apply to cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01.2 - Legal, statutory, regulatory requirements
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP identifies its own relevant legal requirements in order to protect personal data.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01.3 - Legal, statutory, regulatory requirements
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The requirements applicable to the CSC arising from laws and regulations have been identified, especially with regard to geographically distributed processing, storage and communications for which different legislation exists, such as measures arising from the GDPR.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01.4 - Legal, statutory, regulatory requirements
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP provides the CSC with assurance about the applicable legal and contractual requirements.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01.5 - Contractual requirements
policyDefinitionGroups.description: For cloud services, specific measures have been taken and responsibilities have been appointed.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.01.6 - Approach
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has adopted all laws and regulations that apply to it for the provision of cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.02 - Cloud Security Strategy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP should have developed a cloud security strategy that demonstrably supports information security.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.02.1 - Cloud Security Strategy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP's cloud security strategy outlines how it supports the business objectives of CSC(s)

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.02.2 - Cloud Security Strategy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP's cloud security strategy pays attention to the current security context of the CSP

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.02.3 - Related
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The coherence of security measures of the CSP supports the achievement of the business goals of the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.03 - Exit strategy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The cloud services agreement between the CSP and CSC should include an exit strategy.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.03.1 - Provisions
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSC lays down a number of provisions about the exit scheme in the agreement

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.03.2 - Conditions
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSC can exit during the contract period if there is a non-compliance with agreements.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.04 - Cloud Services Policy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.04 - The CSP should extend its information security policy to address the use of cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.04.1 - Cloud beveiligingsbeleid
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.04.1 - The cloud security policy includes multiple organizational processes and technical solutions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.05 - Transparency
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.05 - The CSP provides the CSC with a description in which the cloud services are specified clearly and transparently.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.05.1 - System-description
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.05.1 - The system description contains the required aspects.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.05.2 - Jurisdiction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.05.2 - The system description provides a specification of jurisdiction over to data storage, processing and backup location

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.05.3 - Research opportunities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.05.3 - The SLA or system description provides a specification for publication requirements and research opportunities.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.05.4 - Certificates
policyDefinitionGroups.description: B.05.4 - The SLA or system description provides a specification on the availability of valid certificates.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.06 - Risk management
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP should have established and maintained the risk management process for the security of cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.06.1 - Responsibilities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The responsibilities of the CSP include developing the information security risk management process.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.06.2 - Responsibilities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The organization of the risk management process has been approved by managers of the CSP.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.06.3 - Risk management process
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The risk management process is systematically described.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.07 - IT functionality
policyDefinitionGroups.description: IT functionalities should be provided from a robust and secure system chain from the CSP to the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.07.1 - IT functionalities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Availability, integrity, and confidentiality measures are in place to secure IT functions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.07.2 - IT functionalities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Technical security measures have been taken against infrastructure protection.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.07.3 - IT functionalities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The IT infrastructure is continuously monitored and controlled to protect against threats.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.07.4 - Robust and secure system chain
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The infrastructure is set up with reliable hardware and software components.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.07.5 - Robust and secure system chain
policyDefinitionGroups.description: There are documented standards and procedures to deal with advanced cyberattacks.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08 - Business Continuity Management
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP should have adequately organized its BCM process.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.1 - Responsibility for BCM
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has appointed an owner for the BCM process and made him responsible for the BCM and compliance policy.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.2 - Responsibility for BCM
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The person responsible for BCM ensures that adequate resources are available to carry out an effective BCM process.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.3 - Responsibility for BCM
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The management of the CSP commits to the established BCM requirements.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.4 - Responsibility for BCM
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The BCM policy and policy for business impact analyses have been established and communicated.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.5 - Policies and procedures
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Policies and procedures for determining the impact of cloud service outages have been documented and communicated.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.6 - Business continuity planning
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has a documented framework for business continuity planning.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.7 - Verification and updating
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Business impact analyses and continuity plans are verified, updated and regularly tested.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.8 - Verification and updating
policyDefinitionGroups.description: During testing, attention is paid to the influence of CSCs (tenants) and third parties.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.08.9 - Computer Centers
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The facilities of the computer centers are secured and are monitored, maintained and regularly tested.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09 - Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: In order to protect company and personal data, the CSP should have security measures in place.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.1 - Security aspects and stages
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Availability, integrity and confidentiality measures have been taken for the storage, processing and transport of data

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.2 - Access and privacy
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: To protect data and privacy, security measures have been taken.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.3 - Classification - labelling
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data and resources in which/on which data is contained are assigned a classification by the controller.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.4 - Classification - labelling
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data related to e-commerce and sent over public networks is adequately classified and protected.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.5 - Classification - labelling
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP applies a uniform classification for information relevant to the development and provision of cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.6 - Ownership
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Ownership of resources that are part of cloud services has been established.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.7 - Ownership
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Upon termination of the cloud service, ownership is established regarding the use, return and deletion of data.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09.8 - Location
policyDefinitionGroups.category: B.09 Privacy and protection of personal data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP specifies and documents at which location (in which country/region) the data is stored.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10 - Security organisation
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP should have appointed a security function and set up a security organisation.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.1 - Security function
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The security function, which is led by a Chief Security Officer, supports the CSP in cloud security policies.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.2 - Security Function
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The security feature provides proactive support for, cloud risk assessment activities; classifying information and systems; use of encryption; securing related projects; developing business continuity program and security audits.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.3 - Organizational Position
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has given the information security organization a formal position within the entire organization.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.4 - Tasks, responsibilities and powers
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has described and assigned information security responsibilities for defining, coordinating and evaluating  to specific officers.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.5 - Tasks, responsibilities and powers
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The tasks, responsibilities and powers are laid down in an authorisation matrix.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.6 - Officials
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Key officers for information security have been appointed and made transparent with an organizational chart.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.7 - Reporting-lines
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The accountability and reporting lines between the officials concerned have been established.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.10.8 - Reporting-lines
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The type, frequency and requirements for the substantive reports have been determined.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.11 - Cloud services architecture
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has established an up-to-date architecture for the interdependence and interdependence of the IT functions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.11.1 - Framework
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The framework contains: security policy, type of cloud service, zoning, trust framework, SLA, certificates.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.11.2 - Coherence and dependencies
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The interrelationship between IT functionalities involved is identified and described.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.01 - Service management policy and evaluation guideline
policyDefinitionGroups.category: C.01 Service management policy and evaluation guideline
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has formulated a service management policy for cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.01.1 - Directives
policyDefinitionGroups.category: C.01 Service management policy and evaluation guideline
policyDefinitionGroups.description: For cloud services, the CSP has guidelines for the design of the service management organization.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.01.2 - Directives
policyDefinitionGroups.category: C.01 Service management policy and evaluation guideline
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has described relevant management processes and effectively set them up.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.01.3 - Control activities and reports
policyDefinitionGroups.category: C.01 Service management policy and evaluation guideline
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSP has guidelines for monitoring activities for cloud service; evaluating and reporting on performance.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.02 - Risk Control
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Risk management and the risk assessment process should be continuously monitored and reviewed.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.02.1 - Monitored and reviewed
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP regularly verifies the criteria used to measure the risks.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.02.2 - Monitored and reviewed
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Identified risks should be monitored and evaluated.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.02.3 - Monitored and reviewed
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSP will continuously focus on information security incidents, weaknesses and threats to monitor risks.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.02.4 - Monitored and reviewed
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP regularly carries out the monitoring activities and mitigates the identified risks.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.02.5 - Monitored and reviewed
policyDefinitionGroups.description: When monitoring and reviewing, elements are addressed in accordance with the BIO.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03 - Compliance and assurance
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP should regularly review  cloud security compliance and issue assurance statement to the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03.1 - Compliancy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: For the governance of the cloud services to the CSC, the CSP has set up a compliance process.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03.2 - Compliancy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP registers the regularly issued performance, security and compliance reports in an administration.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03.3 - Compliancy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The compliance process is preferably connected to an information security management system.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03.4 - Assurance
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has an annual audit carried out on the design and control of the contracted cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03.5 - Assurance
policyDefinitionGroups.description: In the assessment, the third party involves both the cloud environment and the administration.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.03.6 - Junction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP ensures that the results of the annual audits of the cloud security policy are in line with each other.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04 - Technical vulnerability management
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information on technical vulnerabilities of information systems used should be obtained in a timely manner.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.1 - Technical vulnerabilities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSP makes CSC information available for the management of technical vulnerabilities that can affect cloud services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.2 - Technical vulnerabilities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSP has defined and established roles and responsibilities for managing technical vulnerabilities.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.3 - Technical vulnerabilities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: If the probability of abuse and the expected damage are both high (NCSC classification vulnerability warnings), patches are installed as soon as possible, but no later than within a week. In the meantime, mitigating measures are taken on the basis of an explicit risk assessment.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.4 - Timelines
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The timeframe within which to respond to announcements of potentially relevant vulnerabilities has been defined.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.5 - Timelines
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Periodically, penetration tests on ICT components are carried out to identify weaknesses.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.6 - Technical vulnerabilities
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Technical weaknesses can be remedied by performing patch management in a timely manner, which includes: identifying, registering and acquiring patches; the decision-making around the use of patches; testing patches; performing patches; registering implemented patches.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.7 - Evaluated
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Evaluations of technical vulnerabilities are recorded and reported.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.04.8 - Evaluated
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The evaluation reports contain suggestions for improvement and are communicated with managers/owners of ICT components in which vulnerabilities and weaknesses have been found.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05 - Security Monitoring Reporting
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The performance of the information security of the cloud environment should be monitored regularly.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05.1 - Monitored and reported
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Guidelines and agreements for monitoring and reporting on information security have been established and applied.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05.2 - Monitored and reported
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Monitoring and reporting on information security are related to the strategic goals it can affect.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05.3 - Monitored and reported
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The monitoring of information security and reports takes place by collecting information from KPIs and KRIs.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05.4 - Monitored and reported
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Information security reports are analyzed in conjunction with reports from other management disciplines.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05.5 - Monitored and reported
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Demonstrably, follow-up is given to improvement proposals from analysis reports.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.05.6 - Monitored and reported
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The security plans shall be periodically updated and assigned to the responsible officials.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.06 - Management organisation cloud services
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has set up a management organisation in which the process structure and the tasks of officers are defined.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.06.1 - Process structure
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The coherence of processes is recorded in a process structure.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.06.2 - Tasks, responsibilities and powers
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSP has described tasks and responsibilities for the execution of management activities in an authorisation matrix.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: C.06.3 - Officials
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The most important officers for the control organisation have been appointed and made transparent.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.01 - Standards for Cloud Services
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP demonstrably applies national and international standards for the services and the interaction with the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.01.1 - National standards
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP makes its services transparent, so that the CSC can demonstrably comply with the mandatory BIO standards.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.01.2 - International standards
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP takes security measures based on international standards.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.02 - Risk assessment
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP should carry out a risk assessment for cloud services of the CSP.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.02.1 - Risk analysis
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The risks to the resources covered by the scope of cloud services are described with risk assessment criteria.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.02.2 - Risk assessment
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The identified risks are evaluated with risk acceptance criteria.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.03 - Redundancy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The agreed continuity is guaranteed by sufficiently logical or physically multiple system functions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.03.1 - Redundancy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The agreed continuity is guaranteed by sufficiently logical or physically multiple system functions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.03.2 - Continuity requirements
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The continuity requirements for cloud services agreed with the CSC organization are ensured by specific measures described in the system architecture.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.04 - Data and Cloud Service Recovery
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.04 Data and Cloud Service Recovery
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The recovery function of the data and cloud services must be robust and periodically tested.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.04.1 - Restore Function
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.04 Data and Cloud Service Recovery
policyDefinitionGroups.description: In the event of calamities, the data and cloud services are restored within the agreed period and maximum data loss and made available to the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.04.2 - Restore Function
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.04 Data and Cloud Service Recovery
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The continuous process of recoverable protection of data is monitored.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.04.3 - Tested
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.04 Data and Cloud Service Recovery
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The adequate functioning of recovery functions is periodically tested by qualified personnel and the results are shared with the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.05 - Data protection
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data with the classification BBN2 or higher should be protected with cryptographic measures and comply with Dutch law.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.05.1 - Cryptographic measures
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data transport is secured with cryptography to the latest state of the art (in accordance with the Forum for Standardization), whereby the key management is carried out by the CSC itself if possible.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.05.2 - Cryptographic measures
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data stored in the cloud service shall be protected to the latest state of the art with encryption and with a key length sufficient at least for the purpose, whereby the key management is not purchased as a cloud service if possible and is carried out by the CSC itself.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.06 - Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.06 Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Archived data should be stored for the agreed retention period and destroyed at the direction of the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.06.1 - Retention period
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.06 Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The guaranteed storage period agreed with the CSP is contractually stipulated and complies with the Archives Act.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.06.2 - Technology-independent consultable
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.06 Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data can be consulted independently of the technology used by the CSP during the entire retention period.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.06.3 - Immutable
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.06 Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: If possible, data is archived using Write Once Read Many technology, which guarantees the integrity of the data.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.06.4 - Destroyed
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.06 Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Prior to modifying storage media for maintenance purposes, the CSC's data is securely erased or destroyed.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.06.5 - Destroyed
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.06 Data retention and data destruction
policyDefinitionGroups.description: U.06.5 - Upon termination of the contractual relationship,  CSC data is securely erased.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.07 - Data separation
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSC data should be isolated from management functions and data from other services to other CSCs, which the CSP manages.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.07.1 - Isolated
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Permanent isolation of data is realized within a multi-tenant architecture. Patches and adjustments of applications and infrastructure are realized in a controlled manner for all cloud services that the CSC purchases.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.07.2 - Isolated
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Isolation of CSC data is ensured by separating it at least logically from the data of other CSCs.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.07.3 - Management features
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Isolation of CSC data is ensured by separating it at least logically from the data of other CSCs under all operating conditions.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.08 - Separation of services
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The cloud infrastructure is set up in such a way that the services to users of information services are separated.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.08.1 - Divorced
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP realizes verifiable separation of the CSCs in a multi-tenant environment and internal CSP environment

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.09 - Malware Protection
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Control measures should be implemented to protect against malware.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.09.1 - Controls
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP specifies which measures should be taken at which position in the information chain of the CSC and CSP.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.09.2 - Controls
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has equipped the IT systems with malware protection and removal tools.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.09.3 - Detection, prevention and recovery
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The malware protection is carried out on various environments, such as on mail servers, (desktop) computers and when accessing the organization's network. The scan for malware includes: all files received over networks or through any form of storage medium, even before use; all attachments and downloads even before use; virtual machines; network traffic.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.10 - Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.10 Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Users should only have access to IT services and data for which they are specifically authorized.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.10.1 - Users
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.10 Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP only provides the CSC with access to services, IT services and data for which it is specifically authorised.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.10.2 - Users
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.10 Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Under the responsibility of the CSP, administrators shall be granted access: to data with the least privilege principle; to data with the need-to-know principle; with multi-factor authentication; to data and application functions via technical measures.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.10.3 - Users
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.10 Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Only users with authenticated equipment can access IT services and data.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.10.4 - Competent
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.10 Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Under the responsibility of the CSP, privileges for users are granted through formal procedures.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.10.5 - Competent
policyDefinitionGroups.category: U.10 Access to IT services and data
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Under the responsibility of the CSP, privileges (system authorisations) for users are granted through formal procedures.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.11 - Crypto services
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Sensitive data of the CSC should be encrypted in accordance with the agreed policy on cryptographic measures.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.11.1 - Policy
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The cryptography policy includes at least the following topics: when cryptography is used; who is responsible for the implementation of cryptology; who is responsible for key management; which standards serve as a basis for cryptography and the way in which the standards of the Standardisation Forum are applied; the way in which the level of protection is determined; in the case of communication between organizations, the policy is determined among themselves.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.11.2 - Cryptographic measures
policyDefinitionGroups.description: In the case of PKIoverheid certificates: apply the PKIoverheid requirements with regard to key management. In other situations: use the ISO 11770 standard for managing cryptographic keys.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.11.3 - Encrypted
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Sensitive data (on transport and at rest) is always encrypted, with private keys managed by the CSC. The use of a private key by the CSP is based on a controlled procedure and must be jointly agreed with the CSC organisation.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.1 - Network Connections
policyDefinitionGroups.description: In connection points with external or untrusted zones, measures have been taken to identify and respond to possible attacks that negatively affect the availability of information (e.g. Distributed Denial of Service attacks (DDos) attacks).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.2 - Network Connections
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Physical and virtualized network components are designed and configured in such a way that network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are limited and monitored (monitored).

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15.1 - Events Logged
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The violation of the policy rules is recorded by the CSP and the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15.3 - Events Logged
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP maintains a list of all assets that are critical in terms of logging and monitoring and regularly reviews this list for correctness.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.17.1 - Encrypted
policyDefinitionGroups.description: CSC data on transport and at rest is encrypted.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12 - Interfaces
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The  network connections in the chain from CSC to CSP should be monitored to limit the risks of data breaches.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.3 - Network connections
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Management activities of the CSP are strictly separated from the data of the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.4 - Network connections
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Data traffic for CSCs are separated at the network level in shared network environments.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.5 - Monitored
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The data traffic entering or leaving the CSP  is  monitored and analyzed for malicious elements.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.6 - Monitored
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The CSP has integrated Intrusion Detection Prevention (IDP) and Intrusion Detection System (IDS) into a SIEM.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.12.7 - Composed
policyDefinitionGroups.description: In the event of discovered new threats, these are mandatory shared within the government.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.13 - Service Orchestration
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Service orchestration provides coordination, aggregation, and composition of the cloud service provided to the CSC.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.13.1 - Coordination
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Cloud orchestration technology works with heterogeneous systems and potentially global cloud deployment.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.13.2 - Service components
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The functional coherence of the service components is described.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.13.3 - Service components
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Orchestration of cloud services requires the following information: CSC ID; business relationship; CSC IP address.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.14 - Interoperability and portability
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Cloud services can be used on different IT platforms and can connect and transfer data.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.14.1 - Interoperability
policyDefinitionGroups.description: To ensure interoperability of cloud services, data is available in accordance with recognized industry standards.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.14.2 - Portability
policyDefinitionGroups.description: To ensure the portability of the data, CSP uses secure network protocols to ensure integrity and confidentiality.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15 - Logging and monitoring
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Log files containing information security events are recorded and regularly monitored and reviewed.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15.2 - Events logged
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The Security Operation Centre (SOC) have clear rules about when an incident must be reported.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15.4 - Events logged
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Strict requirements are imposed on logs and monitoring.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15.5 - Events logged
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Access to and management of the logging and monitoring is limited to authorized employees of the CSP.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.15.6 - Events logged
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Changes in logging and monitoring are monitored by independent and authorized employees.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.16 - Cloud Services Architecture
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The cloud services architecture specifies the coherence and security of the services between the CSC and the CSP.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.16.1 - Cohesion
policyDefinitionGroups.description: The architecture specifies IT services and functions assigned or outsourced by the CSP to subcontractors.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.17 - Multi-tenant architecture
policyDefinitionGroups.description: With multi-tenancy, the CSC data within cloud services is encrypted at rest and processed on hardened machines.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.17.2 - Divorced
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Virtual machine platforms for CSCs with special/increased security requirements are set up separately.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: U.17.3 - Hardened
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Virtual machine platforms are hardened.

metadata.displayName: Effect

metadata.displayName: Resource Types
Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

schema.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all resources.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of values, a key, and an operator.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.
